lead_paragraph: Areas like computing and mobile devices have made advances, but the government has reported disappointingly slow growth and continuing stagnation in productivity.

headline.print_headline: So Much Work Is Going Digital,  but Productivity Remains Stuck
headline.main: Why the Economic Payoff From Technology Is So Elusive

snippet: Areas like computing and mobile devices have made advances, but the government has reported disappointingly slow growth and continuing stagnation in productivity.
abstract: McKinsey & Co study finds advance of digital technology has had lackluster effect upon economy, with prolonged slow growth and productivity remaining slack; finds only 18 percent of economy is realizing its digital potential by becoming more productive and profitable as result of technological innnovations; government has spent billions of dollars in subsidies to bring medicine into digital age, to seemingly little avail.
